other_tests.findings: Tumor had typical features of a paraganglioma with an organoid arrangement of tumor cells with pink granular cytoplasm and nuclear pleomorphism.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During a second operation, the tumor was histologically similar to the previous one.

other_tests.findings: A para-aortic mass was discovered; confirmed to be a solid, encapsulated, red-brown tumor, 3.5 by 3.5 cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeated CT and 131I-metaiodobenzylguanidine scanning have not detected tumor recurrence.

other_tests.findings: Urinary excretion of metanephrines raised suspicion of tumor recurrence.
Hematocrit value rose, requiring monitoring and treatment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Slight elevation of hematocrit during 2004 through the time of publication.

other_tests.findings: Serum erythropoietin level was 48 mU/mL before the resection and 32 mU/mL 8 days after the resection.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The relationship between the erythrocytosis and erythropoietin production by the tumor was ruled out.
